+  @unittest.skipIf(

body: Optional: maybe use `os.name == 'nt'` instead? We're using that elsewhere in the code, and [as far as I can tell](https://stackoverflow.com/a/11672585/3574081) it provides the same information a little bit more cheaply, using a compile-time constant rather than [shelling out to `uname`](https://github.com/python/cpython/blob/5c4b0d063aba0a68c325073f5f312a2c9f40d178/Lib/platform.py#L755) on POSIX-compliant platforms.
body_html: Optional: maybe use os.name == 'nt' instead? We're using that elsewhere in the code, and as far as I can tell it provides the same information a little bit more cheaply, using a compile-time constant rather than shelling out to uname on POSIX-compliant platforms.
body_text: Optional: maybe use os.name == 'nt' instead? We're using that elsewhere in the code, and as far as I can tell it provides the same information a little bit more cheaply, using a compile-time constant rather than shelling out to uname on POSIX-compliant platforms.
